      protected org.hibernate.criterion.Criterion getTextCriterion(java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.String value, org.hibernate.criterion.MatchMode matchMode)
      Returns the text criterion for searching text in the autocompletemodel This is used in MatchMode when AbstractAmpAutoCompleteModel.PARAM.EXACT_MATCH is false, or using Restrictions.eq(String, Object) when AbstractAmpAutoCompleteModel.PARAM.EXACT_MATCH is true This is done to simplify the search scheme, which is almost identical for both searching and for selecting an item

      • getTextCriterion

        protected org.hibernate.criterion.Criterion getTextCriterion(java.lang.String propertyName,

      • getTextCriterion

        protected org.hibernate.criterion.Criterion getTextCriterion(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                             java.lang.String value,
                                                             org.hibernate.criterion.MatchMode matchMode)
        Returns the text criterion for searching text in the autocompletemodel This is used in MatchMode when AbstractAmpAutoCompleteModel.PARAM.EXACT_MATCH is false, or using Restrictions.eq(String, Object) when AbstractAmpAutoCompleteModel.PARAM.EXACT_MATCH is true This is done to simplify the search scheme, which is almost identical for both searching and for selecting an item
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the hibernate property name where the text is stored
        value - the keyword to search for
        Returns:
        a Criterion that can be added to the main Criteria

      • getUnaccentILikeExpression

        protected org.hibernate.criterion.Criterion getUnaccentILikeExpression(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                                       java.lang.String value,

      • addToRootTree

        protected void addToRootTree(java.util.Collection<AmpAutoCompleteDisplayable> tree,
                             AmpAutoCompleteDisplayable obj,
                             boolean searchHit)
        This recursive method adds to the sector root tree the given sector. It does this only if this sector has no parent (it's a root sector). Otherwise it will add itself to the parent sector tree (this becoming visible in rendering). It also makes sure the parent, if not null, goes through the same loop thus adding its way to the root parent. If our current sector is a search hit (it was discovered by mysql search) it also adds its children, if any, to the results. It also ignores softdeleted entries, if said objects are softdeletable.
        Parameters:
        tree - the output tree with sector results
        obj - the current sector to be added
        searchHit - if this current sector is a search hit (if it has been found externally by mysql or its through recursive call

      • addToRootList

        protected void addToRootList(java.util.Collection<AmpAutoCompleteDisplayable> list,
                             AmpAutoCompleteDisplayable obj)
        Helper method that translates the results tree into a results list, displayable by the dropdown. This recursive method adds the current sector to the list and then all its children
        Parameters:
        list - the output list
        obj - the sector to be added to the output list

      • createTreeView

        protected java.util.Collection<? extends AmpAutoCompleteDisplayable> createTreeView(java.util.Collection l)
        Creates the tree view for comboboxes
        Parameters:
        l - the input list of objects to be displayed in tree-like structure
        Returns:
        the list of full objects with parents that can be directly diplayed by the combobox if PARAM.EXACT_MATCH is true, do not process further
